climbs.name: Aerial Ballet
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Amy Cao, October, 2021

content.description:
From the belay station of Crack Machine move straight up then slightly right through a corner that leads to a small roof. Move left onto a slab then climb a crack system to a ledge and bolted anchor. 



Between Crack Machine and Zen. 

Single rack to 2" piece. Bolted anchor, 2 protection bolts.

climbs.name: After Midnight
climbs.fa: Mike Delaney, Mike Parker and Greg Hughes

content.description:
Traverse right off the tree ledge to a hand and fist crack that leads to the top of the cliff.  Splendid jamming. Double up on #1 through #3 camalots or run it out.

You will find this route on the right end of a tree ledge about 100" feet above the ground at the Main Wall.
Single rack to 4".  Bolted anchors.

climbs.name: Blackcrack
climbs.fa: Max Fisher and Mike Parker

content.description:
Climb up the wide crack to a ledge and then continue up the face. Instead of going up the right trending ramp halfway up the face step slightly left and join the upper half of the first pitch of Crack Machine. Technical, sustained climbing at the grade with great gear.

Start down and right of Crack Machine below a series of vertical cracks that lead to a face. Rap the route.
Standard rack to 4".  Bolted anchor/rappel station.

climbs.name: Blackfly
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Adam Morgan

content.description:
Climb up the wide crack to a ledge and then continue up the face to a right trending ramp. Follow the ramp to a small ledge and bolt anchor.

Start down and right of Crack Machine below a series of vertical cracks that lead to a face.  Rappel the route.
Standard rack to 4".  Two bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Boogers
climbs.fa: P.J. Adamson and Eric Samis

content.description:
Same start as Nightbird. Climb up to the arch and then traverse left under the arch all the way over to the end then continue up The Nose.  Be certain to exit left of the roof on the Nose, that will bring you to the bolted anchor.

This line follows the obvious corner that diagonals across the long arching roof on the lower part of main wall.
Single rack to 1".  Doubling up on cams to .75" might be a good idea.  Bolted anchor at 100 feet.

climbs.name: Combat Math
climbs.fa: Mike Parker, Greg Hughes, Shawn Bethune

content.description:
Start down and right of the White Pine tree near a big v shaped groove on the slab. Climb the groove (or cracks just left) to the arch. Make difficult moves to get on top of the next slab and continue up sustained technical face climbing to finish on the tree ledge. A tough onsight and mental testpiece.

Main Wall
Single rack to 2".  Bolted rappel station.

climbs.name: Crack Machine Direct
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Shawn Bethune, October, 2021

content.description:
Fantastic alt start to a great route. Two bolts and some gear for pro. Enjoy.



Just right of the original start on a flat face with a series of thin cracks and pods. 

2 bolts and small cams/nuts.

climbs.name: The Crack Machine
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Adam Morgan and Terry Melanson

content.description:
Pitch 1: Start on the far left side of the Main Wall. down near the very bottom of the long high angle slab. From the left edge of the wall gain a short right trending ramp that leads to a ledge.  From here ascend a series of cracks that follow the left side of the face to a small ledge and 2 bolt anchor.

Pitch 2: Step left and move up toward a pair of handcracks. Enjoy steep jamming through the crux of the second pitch until the cracks disappear and the angle eases off. Move slightly right to a diagonal crack system and follow this to a bolted anchor near the top of the cliff. 


The first route on the Main Wall.  From the left edge of the wall look for a short right trending ramp that leads to a large ledge. The route follows discontinuous cracks more or less straight up from here.  Two raps on a single rope will get you back to the ground.
Single rack to 3".  Excellent pro throughout this climb.

climbs.name: Detour
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Chris MacLellan, Annette Boerlage

content.description:
Crux is up high gaining the final overlap before the anchor. Nice movement on good stone. Very insecure feeling pulling the crux moves. Yikes!

Start is just left of Nightbird on the slab.  Follow the thin line up through two overlaps leading to a vertical crack just right of a corner.
Single rack to 2". Tricky gear and some run outs on easier terrain.  The initial moves through the crux protect well but there is not much gear from there to the anchor and it would be very hard to stop and place it.  Tree anchor.

climbs.name: Five Easy Pieces
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Mike Parker

content.description:
Ten feet right of Take Me to Your Leader and the bolted rap station follow another easy great crack to the top of the cliff.

Single rack to 4".  Bolted anchors

climbs.name: Gunsmoke and The Truth
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Mike Parker and Mike Delaney

content.description:
Great variety of climbing, starting on slab then moving through an overlap followed by a steep technical crux.

Located on Main Wall, between Blackfly and Neutral Tribe.
Single rack to 1".  Maybe double up on small cams.  4 bolts.  Bolted rap station.

climbs.name: The Hallway
climbs.fa: Shawn Bethune, Denise Hamel and Greg Hughes

content.description:
Climb the slab in between Combat Math and Trolley Tracks past a bolt to the overlap. Clip another bolt and pull the overlap to the next slab moving up and a bit left with discontinuous cracks for gear.  A few steeper face moves gets you into a very shallow flaring chimney (the hallway).  Stem through this and up to a short left facing corner.  Exit the corner onto the ledge on the right and continue up easy cracks to the big tree ledge and the anchor.   Double or triple up on cams from purple to yellow tcu size.   Three alternate finishes are possible and all are great climbing.  Iron Cross finish  At 2/3rds height just after entering the hallway break right and climb the obvious overhanging finger to wide hand crack only at 5.11.c Boulder finish  At the top of the short left facing corner continue straight up the crack and overhanging face (V2).Left finish  The left part of the boulder 2m left of the crack.  Hard to protect well but a fun TR (V1).

Single rack to 2".  Doubling up on small cams is a good idea.  Tri cams are useful.  2 bolts.  Bolted rap anchor.

climbs.name: Neutral Tribe
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Mike Parker

content.description:
Pitch 1: Start is near the center of Main Wall just left of a flat ledge. Start in a thin crack that leads up to an overlap. From the overlap climb the beautiful hand crack to a two bolt anchor and belay. 100 feet

Pitch 2: Continue up and slightly right through a crack system then aim for the steep crack at the top. 100 feet


Standard rack to 3".  Not a bad idea to double up on 1 and 2 inch cams.

climbs.name: Nightbird
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Mike Delaney

content.description:
Climb up to the arch and ascend the corner crack directly above. Continue straight up then move right around a long detached block finishing on the right side of the big tree ledge above.

Start on the far right end of Main Wall below the right end of a big long arch.  Rap the route.
Single rack to 3".  Bolted anchor.

climbs.name: Nightbird Direct
climbs.fa: Eric Samis, Sam Jones and Kate Trecartin

content.description:
Same as Nightbird but follow a plumb line to the tree ledge instead of moving right around the detached block about 3/4 of the way up.

Same as Nightbird.
Single rack to 3".

climbs.name: The Nose
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Mike Parker

content.description:
Pitch 1: Start in a crack below and slightly left of the left end of the long arching roof. This is near the middle of the wall. Climb the cracks to a small overlap. Move up through the overlap and traverse right a few feet then up toward a bolt. Clip the bolt and continue up toward a roof. There are two finishes available. Move left around the roof and continue up onto the ledge or move right under the roof and follow jugs to the ledge. Belay at the bolted anchor on the ledge. 5.8+ 100 feet

Pitch 2: At the left end of the tree ledge continue up on a system of cracks and ledges to the top. 5.5 90 feet



This route is found in the middle of the Main Wall. It starts below the left side of the long arching overlap that runs half way across the Main Wall. Two raps on a 60 meter will get you back to the ground.


Standard rack to 3". A bolt protects a run out on the first pitch. Bolted anchors. Rap the route.

climbs.name: Octopus Ink
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Mike Parker

content.description:
Pitch 1: Begin on the arete and the cross over it when possible trending right to reach the bolted anchor for Crack Machine and belay. There is good gear but you have to look for it! 5.8 80 feet 
 Pitch 2: The money pitch. Move up through a niche into the right trending finger and hand crack that leads to the top of the right half of the cliff. 5.6 100 feet

This route starts on the right hand side of X Wall and crosses over the arête to the Main Wall. You can take the Dance Platform start and then move right to the arête or scramble up to the large Spruce tree and begin just right near a hardwood stump.  To descend walk back over to the middle of the top (moving to the left) and make two rappels to get back to the ground.
Standard rack to 4".  Gear on the first pitch is a little tricky.  Tree anchor on the top.

climbs.name: Scars and Stripes
climbs.fa: Will Jones

content.description:
This is the hardest line on the cliff so far.  Steep climbing on small edges and crimps through the crux which is slightly run out.  Not for the faint of heart.

On Main Wall take the same start as The Nose directly in front of the Pine Tree.  Instead of traversing right as per The Nose continue straight up through a very thin crack to the Neutral Tribe bolted rap station.
Standard rack of nuts and cams to 2".  Bring small nuts and cams to protect the crux.

climbs.name: Steve French
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Mike Parker, Mike Delaney

content.description:
Locate a steep crack system near the right end of the tree ledge just left of After Midnight. Follow the crack until it merges with After Midnight.

Single rack to 4".  Bolted anchors.
Located on a tree ledge 100" off the ground above The Main Wall.  This route is between After Midnight and Five Easy Pieces.

climbs.name: Take Me To Your Leader
climbs.fa: Mike Parker, Greg Hughes and Mike Delaney

content.description:
On the left end of the ledge directly above a two bolt rap station, climb up through an easy but fun crack system to the top of the cliff.

This route is on a big tree ledge about 100" above the Main Wall.
Single rack to 3".  Bolted anchors.

climbs.name: Trolley Tracks
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Mike Parker

content.description:
Climb cracks/slab to the arch. Move up and over the arch to the next slab. Climb up through a tricky overlap which leads to a steep vertical hand crack. Follow this to the top of the ledge. There are a couple of run outs on marginal gear. Lots of spice on this one.

Located 10 feet right of the big v shaped groove on the slab of the Main Wall. Look for twin finger cracks about a foot apart.
Single rack to 2".  Bolted anchor.

climbs.name: Zen
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Mike Parker, Mike Delaney

content.description:
From the top of the first pitch of Neutral Tribe head straight up on gorgeous face climbing joining the final 40 feet of Neutral Tribe. The pro is not readily apparent from the bottom of the route but it is all there. Probably the best pitch on the cliff!

You must climb either Blackfly or the first pitch of Neutral Tribe to reach this climb.  Two raps on a 60 meter will get you back to the ground.
Standard rack to 3".  A purple tcu protects a run out.  Tree anchor on the top of the cliff.
This is the tall wall you see as you first approach the cliff from the camping area.
